articles.title: Macarca Telaffuz Rehberi: Partnerinizi Etkileyin
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';

Macarca, Ural-Altay dil ailesinden gelen benzersiz bir dildir ve Avrupa'daki cogu dilden oldukca farklidir. Ancak iyi haber su: Macarca b√ºy√ºk √∂lc√ºde fonetik bir dildir - yazildigi gibi okunur! Bu rehberde, Macarca sesleri dogru telaffuz etmenizi saglayacak t√ºm ipuclarini bulacaksiniz.

## Macarca Alfabe ve √ñzel Harfler

Macarca alfabe 44 harf icerir (14 √ºnl√º, 30 √ºns√ºz). Bazi harfler T√ºrkce'de yoktur:

### √únl√ºler (Mag√°nhangz√≥k)

<VocabCard
  word="a, √°, e, √©, i, √≠, o, √≥, √∂, ≈ë, u, √∫, √º, ≈±"
  translation="14 Macarca √ºnl√º"
  pronunciation="Kisa ve uzun ciftler"
  example="Aksanli harfler uzun s√∂ylenir"
/>

#### Kisa ve Uzun √únl√º Ciftleri

| Kisa | Uzun | √ñrnek |
|------|------|-------|
| **a** [o gibi] | **√°** [a] | alma (elma) / m√°ma (anne) |
| **e** [e] | **√©** [ey] | lehet (olabilir) / sz√©p (g√ºzel) |
| **i** [i] | **√≠** [ii] | mit (ne) / v√≠z (su) |
| **o** [o] | **√≥** [oo] | jobb (daha iyi) / j√≥ (iyi) |
| **√∂** [√∂] | **≈ë** [√∂√∂] | k√∂nyv (kitap) / n≈ë (kadin) |
| **u** [u] | **√∫** [uu] | fut (kosar) / √∫r (bey) |
| **√º** [√º] | **≈±** [√º√º] | √ºt (vurur) / t≈± (igne) |

<CultureTip title="Kisa 'a' Dikkat!" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Macarca'da kisa "a" harfi T√ºrkce "a" gibi degil, daha √ßok "o"ya yakin s√∂ylenir! "Alma" (elma) "olma" gibi duyulur. Uzun "√°" ise normal T√ºrkce "a" gibidir.
</CultureTip>

### √ñzel √úns√ºz Kombinasyonlari

<VocabCard
  word="cs, gy, ly, ny, sz, ty, zs"
  translation="Iki harfli tek sesler"
  pronunciation="Her biri tek bir sestir"
  example="cs = T√ºrkce '√ß', sz = T√ºrkce 's'"
/>

| Harf | Ses | T√ºrkce Karsiligi | √ñrnek |
|------|-----|------------------|-------|
| **cs** | √ß | T√ºrkce "√ß" | cs√≥k (√∂p√ºc√ºk) |
| **gy** | dj/dy | yumusak "d" | nagy (b√ºy√ºk) |
| **ly** | y | T√ºrkce "y" | Ilyes (isim) |
| **ny** | ny | yumusak "n" | anya (anne) |
| **sz** | s | T√ºrkce "s" | sz√©p (g√ºzel) |
| **ty** | ty | yumusak "t" | kutya (k√∂pek) |
| **zs** | j | yumusak "j" | zseb (cep) |

## T√ºrk √ñgrenciler Icin Kolay Sesler

Bu sesler T√ºrkce'ye benzer:

| Macarca | T√ºrkce | √ñrnek |
|---------|--------|-------|
| **b, d, f, g, h, k, l, m, n, p, r, t, v, z** | Ayni | h√°z (ev), n√©v (isim) |
| **sz** | s | szeretlek (seni seviyorum) |
| **cs** | √ß | cs√≥k (√∂p√ºc√ºk) |
| **√∂, √º** | √∂, √º | k√∂sz√∂n√∂m (tesekk√ºrler) |

## Dikkat Gerektiren Sesler

### "S" Harfi

<VocabCard
  word="s = ≈ü sesi"
  translation="T√ºrkce '≈ü' gibi"
  pronunciation="sh"
  example="sok (cok) = shok gibi okunur"
/>

Macarca'da "s" harfi T√ºrkce "s" gibi degil, "s" gibi okunur!

- **s** = ≈ü (sokk = ≈üok)
- **sz** = s (sz√©p = sep)

### "Gy" Sesi

<VocabCard
  word="gy"
  translation="Yumusak d + y"
  pronunciation="dj/dy"
  example="magyar (Macar) = ma-dyar"
/>

Bu ses T√ºrkce'de yoktur. "D" ve "y" birlesimi gibi d√ºs√ºn√ºn:
- **nagy** [nadj] = b√ºy√ºk
- **gyere** [dye-re] = gel
- **dr√°g√°m** [dra-djam] = sevgilim

### "Ny" Sesi

<VocabCard
  word="ny"
  translation="Yumusak n"
  pronunciation="ny"
  example="anya (anne) = a-nya"
/>

Ispanyolca "√±" gibi:
- **anya** [a-nya] = anne
- **konyha** [ko-nya] = mutfak

<CultureTip title="Iki Harfli Sesler" flag="üá≠üá∫">
cs, gy, ly, ny, sz, ty, zs harfleri her zaman tek bir ses olarak okunur. Asla ayri ayri s√∂ylenmeleri gerektigini d√ºs√ºnmeyin! "Szeretlek"te "sz" tek bir "s" sesidir.
</CultureTip>

## Vurgu Kurallari

Macarca'da vurgu **her zaman ilk hecede**dir. Bu, T√ºrkce'den farklidir ama Cekce'ye benzer:

<VocabCard
  word="SZEretlek"
  translation="Seni seviyorum"
  pronunciation="SZE-ret-lek"
  example="Vurgu ilk hecede"
/>

### √ñrnekler

| Kelime | Vurgu | Anlam |
|--------|-------|-------|
| **SZEretlek** | SZE-ret-lek | seni seviyorum |
| **K√ñsz√∂n√∂m** | K√ñ-sz√∂-n√∂m | tesekk√ºrler |
| **BUdapest** | BU-da-pesht | Budapeste |
| **GY√ñny√∂r≈±** | DY√ñ-ny√∂-r√º | g√ºzel |
| **√âdesem** | E-de-shem | tatliim |

## Romantik Kelimeler Telaffuz Pratigi

<VocabCard
  word="Szeretlek"
  translation="Seni seviyorum"
  pronunciation="SE-ret-lek"
  example="Szeretlek, √©desem!"
/>

### Temel Ask Kelimeleri

| Kelime | Telaffuz | Anlam |
|--------|----------|-------|
| **szerelem** | SE-re-lem | ask |
| **sz√≠v** | siv | kalp |
| **cs√≥k** | csok | √∂p√ºc√ºk |
| **√∂lel√©s** | √ñ-le-lesh | sarilma |
| **dr√°g√°m** | DRA-djam | sevgilim |
| **√©desem** | E-de-shem | tatliim |

### G√ºnl√ºk Ifadeler

| Ifade | Telaffuz | Anlam |
|-------|----------|-------|
| **J√≥ reggelt** | YO reg-gelt | G√ºnaydƒ±n |
| **J√≥ est√©t** | YO esh-tet | Iyi aksamlar |
| **J√≥ √©jszak√°t** | YO ey-sa-kat | Iyi geceler |
| **K√∂sz√∂n√∂m** | K√ñ-s√∂-n√∂m | Tesekk√ºrler |
| **Szia** | SI-ya | Merhaba/Hosca kal |

## Uzun ve Kisa √únl√ºlerin √ñnemi

Macarca'da uzun ve kisa √ºnl√ºler kelimenin anlamini degistirebilir:

<VocabCard
  word="kor vs k√≥r"
  translation="yas vs hastalik"
  pronunciation="kor vs koor"
  example="Uzunluk anlami degistirir!"
/>

| Kisa | Uzun | Anlam Farki |
|------|------|-------------|
| **kor** (yas) | **k√≥r** (hastalik) | farkli anlam |
| **√∂t** (bes) | **≈ët** (onu) | farkli anlam |
| **sz√∫r** (bicaklar) | **szur** (yok) | farkli anlam |

## Ciftler Icin Telaffuz Oyunlari

### Oyun 1: Minimal Ciftler
Benzer kelimeleri ayirt etmeye calisin:
- **kar** (kol) vs **k√°r** (yazik)
- **hal** (balik) vs **h√°l** (minnettar)
- **√∂t** (bes) vs **≈ët** (onu)

### Oyun 2: Romantik Tekerleme
Birbirinize bu ifadeyi s√∂yleyin:
**"Szeretlek, sz√≠vem, sz√©p vagy!"** [SE-ret-lek SI-vem SEP vadj]

### Oyun 3: Sevgi S√∂zc√ºkleri Pratigi
Her g√ºn farkli bir sevgi s√∂zc√ºg√º telaffuz edin:
- Pazartesi: **√©desem** [E-de-shem]
- Sali: **dr√°g√°m** [DRA-djam]
- Carsamba: **kincsem** [KIN-csem]
- Persembe: **sz√≠vem** [SI-vem]
- Cuma: **szerelmem** [SE-rel-mem]

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy ma este"
  translation="Bu aksam cok g√ºzelsin"
  pronunciation="DY√ñ-ny√∂-r√º vadj ma ESH-te"
  context="Romantik bir iltifatla pratik yapin"
/>

## Yaygin Telaffuz Hatalari

| Hatali | Dogru | Neden? |
|--------|-------|--------|
| "a" = a | "a" = o gibi | Kisa a farkli |
| "s" = s | "s" = ≈ü | S harfi ≈ü gibi |
| "sz" = sz | "sz" = s | Sz tek ses |
| son hece vurgusu | ilk hece vurgusu | Vurgu her zaman ilk hecede |

## T√ºrk √ñgrenciler Icin Avantajlar

<CultureTip title="Ortak Noktalar" flag="üá≠üá∫">
T√ºrkce ve Macarca bazi ortak √∂zelliklere sahiptir: sesli uyumu, sondan eklemeli yapi ve "√∂/√º" sesleri. Bu, T√ºrk √∂grencilere avantaj saglar!
</CultureTip>

### T√ºrkce'ye Benzerlikler:

1. **√ñ ve √ú sesleri**: T√ºrkce'deki gibi
2. **Sesli uyumu**: Her iki dilde de var
3. **Fonetik yazi**: Yazildigi gibi okunur
4. **Sondan eklemeli**: Ekler sonra gelir

## Pratik Ipuclari

1. **Her g√ºn dinleyin**: Macar sarkilari ve filmleri
2. **Yavas baslayin**: √ñnce kisa kelimeleri pratik edin
3. **Kendinizi kaydedin**: Dinleyin ve karsilastirin
4. **Partnerinizle pratik**: Birbirinizi d√ºzeltin
5. **Sabir**: Gy ve ny sesleri zaman alir

<CultureTip title="M√ºkemmellik Gerekmez" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Macarlar, yabancilarƒ±n dillerini √∂grenmesine cok deger verir. K√º√ß√ºk hatalar √∂nemli degil - cabanƒ±z takdir edilecektir! "Szeretlek" dedignizde, telaffuz m√ºkemmel olmasa bile anlami ulasir.
</CultureTip>

Macarca telaffuz, pratikle gelisir. Partnerinizle birlikte bu sesleri calisarak hem dil becerilerinizi gelistirir hem de eglenceli vakit gecirirsiniz. Her "Szeretlek" s√∂ylediginizde biraz daha iyi olacaksiniz!

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[Macarca Telaffuz](/learn/tr/hu/hungarian-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel Macarca ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/hu/hungarian-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[Macarca Zor mu?](/learn/tr/hu/is-hungarian-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[Macarca Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/hu/hungarian-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA text="Macarca telaffuzunuzu gelistirmeye hazir misiniz?" buttonText="Hemen Baslayin" />

<CultureTip title="Rumunska kuchnia" flag="üá∑üá¥">
Tradycyjna kuchnia rumunska to sarmale (golabki), mici (grillowane mieso), mamaliga (polenta) i papana»ôi (paczki z serem). Sprobujcie czegos typowego!

## ƒÜwiczenia dla par

Odegrajcie scene zamawiania w restauracji - jedna osoba jest kelnerem, druga gosciem.

### Planowanie randki
Uzyjcie rumunskiego do zaplanowania nastepnej randki:
- **"Ce facem s√¢mbƒÉtƒÉ?"** (Co robimy w sobote?)

### Quiz romantyczny

Rumunskie s≈Çownictwo na randke pomoze wam stworzyc niezapomniane romantyczne chwile. Cwiczcie razem i cieszcie siƒô wspolna nauka!

<CTA text="ƒÜwicz wymowƒô z AI, zapisuj s≈Ç√≥wka do Love Log i wysy≈Çaj Word Gifts swojej drugiej po≈Ç√≥wce. Love Languages ≈ÇƒÖczy pary w nauce jƒôzyk√≥w." buttonText="Rozpocznij naukƒô rumu≈Ñskiego" />

articles.title: Portugisiske grammatik-grundl√¶ggende: L√¶r at elske sproget sammen
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Har du nogensinde √∏nsket at hviske s√∏de ord til din partner p√• portugisisk, men blevet forvirret over alle de forskellige verbformer? Du er ikke alene! Portugisisk grammatik kan virke overv√¶ldende i starten, men n√•r du l√¶rer det sammen med din elskede, bliver det pludselig meget sjovere. Ved udgangen af denne guide vil I kunne danne jeres f√∏rste romantiske s√¶tninger og forst√•, hvorfor portugisisk lyder s√• melodisk.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Eu te amo"
  translation="Jeg elsker dig"
  pronunciation="eh-oo tchee AH-moh"
  context="Den mest romantiske s√¶tning p√• portugisisk - perfekt at √∏ve sammen!"
/>

## Den Simple Forklaring: Hvad G√∏r Portugisisk Specielt?

T√¶nk p√• portugisisk som en dans, hvor ordene skifter lidt afh√¶ngigt af, hvem der g√∏r hvad. Mens dansk hovedsageligt bruger r√¶kkef√∏lgen af ord til at vise betydning, bruger portugisisk sm√• endelser p√• ordene. Det er som at give hvert ord en lille hat, der fort√¶ller, hvilken rolle det spiller i s√¶tningen.

Portugisisk har ogs√• to former for "du" - en uformel (**tu**) til venner, familie og din partner, og en formel (**voc√™**) til h√∏flige situationer. Med din elskede bruger du altid **tu** - det g√∏r det hele mere intimt!

## De 5 Grundl√¶ggende Regler (Med Romantiske Eksempler)

### 1. Verb-b√∏jning: Jeg, du, vi, de...

Portugisiske verb skifter endelse afh√¶ngigt af, hvem der handler:

<VocabCard
  word="Eu falo"
  translation="Jeg taler"
  pronunciation="eh-oo FAH-loh"
  example="Eu falo com voc√™ todos os dias."
/>

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Falar (at tale)"
  meaning="to speak"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu (jeg)", polish: "falo", english: "jeg taler" },
    { person: "Tu (du)", polish: "falas", english: "du taler" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela (han/hun)", polish: "fala", english: "han/hun taler" },
    { person: "N√≥s (vi)", polish: "falamos", english: "vi taler" },
    { person: "Eles/Elas (de)", polish: "falam", english: "de taler" }
  ]}
/>

### 2. K√∏n: Maskulint og feminint

I portugisisk har substantiver k√∏n - enten **o** (maskulint) eller **a** (feminitin):

- **o amor** (k√¶rligheden) - maskulint
- **a paix√£o** (passionen) - feminint

Det betyder, at adjektiver og artikler skifter alt efter k√∏n:

<VocabCard
  word="meu amor"
  translation="min k√¶rlighed"
  pronunciation="meh-oo ah-MOHR"
  example="Meu amor, voc√™ √© lindo!"
/>

### 3. Sp√∏rgsm√•l: Bare omvendt r√¶kkef√∏lge!

At stille sp√∏rgsm√•l p√• portugisisk er faktisk nemt - du skal bare omvendt r√¶kkef√∏lge af subjekt og verb:

**Deklarativ:** Voc√™ fala portugu√™s. (Du taler portugisisk.)
**Sp√∏rgsm√•l:** Fala voc√™ portugu√™s? (Taler du portugisisk?)

### 4. Nutid: Tre Verb-typer

Portugisiske verb i nutid ender p√• enten **-ar**, **-er** eller **-ir**:

| Verb-type | Eksempel | B√∏jning (tu) |
|-----------|----------|--------------|
| -ar | falar (tale) | voc√™ **fala** |
| -er | comer (spise) | voc√™ **come** |
| -ir | partir (forlade) | voc√™ **parte** |

### 5. Possessiver: Min, din, vores...

Vis ejerskab med disse possessiver:

<VocabCard
  word="nossa casa"
  translation="vores hus"
  pronunciation="NOH-sah KAH-sah"
  example="Nossa casa √© o seu castelo."
/>

## Romantiske Eksempler I Kan √òve Sammen

| Portugisisk | Dansk | Grammatik-note |
|-------------|-------|----------------|
| **Tu √©s bonito/bonita** | Du er smuk | Bonito (m) / bonita (f) |
| **Eu gosto de voc√™** | Jeg kan lide dig | gosto = 1. person af "gostar" |
| **N√≥s somos felizes** | Vi er lykkelige | felizes = flertal af "feliz" |
| **O meu cora√ß√£o** | Mit hjerte | o + meu = den bestemte form |
| **As nossas mem√≥rias** | Vores minder | feminint flertal |

<CultureTip flag="üáµüáπ" title="Romantisk Grammatik">
Portugisisk har en naturlig melodisk kvalitet, der g√∏r det perfekt til k√¶rlighedserkl√¶ringer. Brug den uformelle **tu** med din partner - det viser intimitet og k√¶rlighed!
</CultureTip>

## Almindelige M√∏nstre til Daglig Brug

### At udtrykke f√∏lelser:
- **Eu estou...** (Jeg er...) + **feliz** (glad) / **triste** (trist) / **apaixonado** (forelsket)

### At planl√¶gge sammen:
- **Vamos...** (Lad os...) + **comer** (spise) / **dan√ßar** (danse) / **viajar** (rejse)

### At give komplimenter:
- **Voc√™ √©...** (Du er...) + **inteligente** / **engra√ßado** (sjov) / **especial** (speciel)

## √òv Disse S√¶tninger Sammen

1. **Eu gosto quando voc√™ sorri.** (eh-oo GOHS-toh KWAHN-doh VOH-seh soh-REE) - Jeg kan lide n√•r du smiler.
2. **Voc√™ faz meu dia melhor.** (VOH-seh fahsh meh-oo DEE-ah mehl-YOHR) - Du g√∏r min dag bedre.
3. **N√≥s vamos ser felizes para sempre.** (nohsh VAH-mohs sehr feh-LEE-zehs PAH-rah SEM-preh) - Vi skal v√¶re lykkelige for evigt.
4. **Onde voc√™ quer jantar?** (OHN-djee VOH-seh kehr zhan-TAHR?) - Hvor vil du spise middag?
5. **Meu amor, pode me ajudar?** (meh-oo ah-MOHR, POH-djee mee ah-zhoo-TAHR?) - Min k√¶rlighed, kan du hj√¶lpe mig?
6. **Eu sempre vou estar aqui para voc√™.** (eh-oo SEM-preh voh eh-STAHR ah-KEE PAH-rah VOH-seh) - Jeg vil altid v√¶re her for dig.
7. **Que tal assistirmos um filme juntos?** (kee tahl ah-sees-TEER-mohs oon FEE-mee ZHOON-tohs?) - Hvad med at se en film sammen?
8. **Voc√™ √© a pessoa mais especial do mundo.** (VOH-seh eh ah peh-SOH-ah mah-eez eh-speh-see-AHL doo MOON-doh) - Du er den mest specielle person i verden.

## De 3 St√∏rste Fejl (Og S√•dan Undg√•r I Dem)

### 1. **Forveksling af "ser" og "estar"**
Begge betyder "at v√¶re", men bruges forskelligt:
- **Ser** (permanent): **Voc√™ √© bonita** (du er smuk)
- **Estar** (midlertidig): **Voc√™ est√° feliz** (du er glad lige nu)

### 2. **Forkert k√∏n p√• ord**
‚ùå **o casa** (forkert)
‚úÖ **a casa** (korrekt - huset er feminint)

### 3. **At glemme person-b√∏jning**
‚ùå **Eu fala** (jeg taler)
‚úÖ **Eu falo** (korrekt b√∏jning)

<CultureTip flag="üáµüáπ" title="K√¶rlighed G√∏r Fejl Okay">
Portugisere er utroligt t√•lmodige med dem, der pr√∏ver at l√¶re deres sprog. Din partner vil elske, at du g√∏r en indsats - perfekt udtale kommer senere!
</CultureTip>

## Hurtig Reference (Gem Dette!)

| Dansk | Portugisisk | Eksempel |
|-------|-------------|----------|
| Jeg elsker | Eu amo | Eu amo voc√™ |
| Du har | Voc√™ tem | Voc√™ tem lindos olhos |
| Vi er | N√≥s somos | N√≥s somos perfeitos juntos |
| De spiser | Eles comem | Eles comem juntos |
| Mit hjerte | Meu cora√ß√£o | Meu cora√ß√£o √© seu |
| Vores k√¶rlighed | Nosso amor | Nosso amor √© eterno |

## Hvad Nu? Tag Jeres Portugisisk Til N√¶ste Niveau!

Nu hvor I mestrer de grundl√¶ggende grammatik-regler, er I klar til mere avancerede romantiske udtryk. √òv jeres udtale med [vores udtale-guide for begyndere](/learn/da/pt/pronunciation-guide-for-beginners/), og l√¶r [s√∏de k√¶lenavne til din partner](/learn/da/pt/portuguese-pet-names-for-your-partner/) for at g√∏re jeres samtaler endnu mere k√¶rlige.

For at g√∏re jeres portugisiske rejse endnu mere romantisk, kan I ogs√• udforske [hvordan man siger jeg elsker dig p√• portugisisk](/learn/da/pt/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-portuguese/) og [romantiske fraser til enhver lejlighed](/learn/da/pt/romantic-portuguese-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

<CTA />

articles.title: Italian Subjunctive Basics: Expressing Wishes and Desires
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

The subjunctive mood (il congiuntivo) is one of the most beautiful aspects of Italian grammar. It allows you to express wishes, hopes, doubts, and emotions - perfect for romantic conversations with your partner. While it may seem challenging at first, learning the subjunctive together will add depth and nuance to your Italian.

## What is the Subjunctive?

The subjunctive isn't used for stating facts but for expressing:
- **Wishes and desires** (Voglio che...)
- **Emotions** (Sono felice che...)
- **Doubts and uncertainty** (Dubito che...)
- **Opinions** (Penso che...)
- **Necessities** (Bisogna che...)

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Voglio che tu sia felice"
  translation="I want you to be happy"
  pronunciation="VOL-yoh keh too SEE-ah feh-LEE-cheh"
  context="Express your deepest wishes for your partner's happiness"
/>

## Present Subjunctive Conjugations

### Regular -ARE Verbs

<ConjugationTable
  verb="amare (congiuntivo presente)"
  meaning="to love"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "che io", "word": "ami", "translation": "that I love" },
    { "person": "che tu", "word": "ami", "translation": "that you love" },
    { "person": "che lui/lei", "word": "ami", "translation": "that he/she love" },
    { "person": "che noi", "word": "amiamo", "translation": "that we love" },
    { "person": "che voi", "word": "amiate", "translation": "that you all love" },
    { "person": "che loro", "word": "amino", "translation": "that they love" }
  ]}
/>

### Regular -ERE Verbs

<ConjugationTable
  verb="credere (congiuntivo presente)"
  meaning="to believe"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "che io", "word": "creda", "translation": "that I believe" },
    { "person": "che tu", "word": "creda", "translation": "that you believe" },
    { "person": "che lui/lei", "word": "creda", "translation": "that he/she believe" },
    { "person": "che noi", "word": "crediamo", "translation": "that we believe" },
    { "person": "che voi", "word": "crediate", "translation": "that you all believe" },
    { "person": "che loro", "word": "credano", "translation": "that they believe" }
  ]}
/>

### Regular -IRE Verbs

<ConjugationTable
  verb="partire (congiuntivo presente)"
  meaning="to leave"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "che io", "word": "parta", "translation": "that I leave" },
    { "person": "che tu", "word": "parta", "translation": "that you leave" },
    { "person": "che lui/lei", "word": "parta", "translation": "that he/she leave" },
    { "person": "che noi", "word": "partiamo", "translation": "that we leave" },
    { "person": "che voi", "word": "partiate", "translation": "that you all leave" },
    { "person": "che loro", "word": "partano", "translation": "that they leave" }
  ]}
/>

<CultureTip title="The Subjunctive is Alive in Italian" flag="üáÆüáπ">
While the subjunctive is dying in many languages, Italians use it constantly in everyday speech. Using it correctly will make you sound much more fluent and natural. Italians notice - and appreciate - when foreigners use the subjunctive properly!
</CultureTip>

## Essential Irregular Subjunctives

### Essere (to be)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="essere (congiuntivo presente)"
  meaning="to be"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "che io", "word": "sia", "translation": "that I be" },
    { "person": "che tu", "word": "sia", "translation": "that you be" },
    { "person": "che lui/lei", "word": "sia", "translation": "that he/she be" },
    { "person": "che noi", "word": "siamo", "translation": "that we be" },
    { "person": "che voi", "word": "siate", "translation": "that you all be" },
    { "person": "che loro", "word": "siano", "translation": "that they be" }
  ]}
/>

### Avere (to have)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="avere (congiuntivo presente)"
  meaning="to have"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "che io", "word": "abbia", "translation": "that I have" },
    { "person": "che tu", "word": "abbia", "translation": "that you have" },
    { "person": "che lui/lei", "word": "abbia", "translation": "that he/she have" },
    { "person": "che noi", "word": "abbiamo", "translation": "that we have" },
    { "person": "che voi", "word": "abbiate", "translation": "that you all have" },
    { "person": "che loro", "word": "abbiano", "translation": "that they have" }
  ]}
/>

### More Irregular Subjunctives

| Infinitive | Subjunctive (io/tu/lui) | Subjunctive (loro) |
|------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| **fare** (do) | faccia | facciano |
| **andare** (go) | vada | vadano |
| **venire** (come) | venga | vengano |
| **dire** (say) | dica | dicano |
| **potere** (can) | possa | possano |
| **volere** (want) | voglia | vogliano |
| **stare** (stay) | stia | stiano |
| **sapere** (know) | sappia | sappiano |

## When to Use the Subjunctive

### Expressing Wishes (Desideri)

<VocabCard
  word="Spero che tu stia bene"
  translation="I hope you are well"
  pronunciation="SPEH-roh keh too STEE-ah BEH-neh"
  example="Sei stanco? Spero che tu stia bene."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Desidero che passiamo pi√π tempo insieme"
  translation="I wish we could spend more time together"
  pronunciation="deh-ZEE-deh-roh keh pahs-see-AH-mo pyoo TEM-poh in-see-EH-meh"
  example="Mi manchi. Desidero che passiamo pi√π tempo insieme."
/>

### Expressing Emotions (Emozioni)

<VocabCard
  word="Sono felice che tu sia qui"
  translation="I'm happy that you are here"
  pronunciation="SO-no feh-LEE-cheh keh too SEE-ah kwee"
  example="Finalmente sei arrivato! Sono felice che tu sia qui."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ho paura che tu non capisca"
  translation="I'm afraid you don't understand"
  pronunciation="oh pah-OO-rah keh too non kah-PEE-skah"
  example="Ho paura che tu non capisca quanto ti amo."
/>

### Expressing Opinions (Opinioni)

<VocabCard
  word="Penso che tu abbia ragione"
  translation="I think you're right"
  pronunciation="PEN-so keh too AHB-bee-ah rah-JOH-neh"
  example="Ci ho pensato e penso che tu abbia ragione."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Credo che siamo fatti l'uno per l'altra"
  translation="I believe we are made for each other"
  pronunciation="KREH-doh keh see-AH-mo FAHT-tee LOO-no per LAHL-trah"
  example="Dopo tutto questo tempo, credo che siamo fatti l'uno per l'altra."
/>

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Mi auguro che i tuoi sogni si avverino"
  translation="I hope your dreams come true"
  pronunciation="mee ow-GOO-roh keh ee twoy SON-yee see ahv-VEH-ree-no"
  context="A beautiful wish for your partner's future"
/>

### Expressing Doubt (Dubbi)

<VocabCard
  word="Non sono sicuro che sia possibile"
  translation="I'm not sure it's possible"
  pronunciation="non SO-no see-KOO-roh keh SEE-ah pos-SEE-bee-leh"
  example="Vorrei, ma non sono sicuro che sia possibile oggi."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dubito che piova domani"
  translation="I doubt it will rain tomorrow"
  pronunciation="DOO-bee-toh keh pee-OH-vah doh-MAH-nee"
  example="Dubito che piova domani, facciamo un picnic?"
/>

## Trigger Words and Phrases

The subjunctive is triggered by certain expressions. Here are the most common:

### Verbs of Wishing

| Italian | English | Example |
|---------|---------|---------|
| **volere che** | to want that | Voglio che tu venga |
| **desiderare che** | to wish that | Desidero che tu sia felice |
| **sperare che** | to hope that | Spero che vada bene |
| **augurarsi che** | to hope/wish that | Mi auguro che tu capisca |

### Verbs of Emotion

| Italian | English | Example |
|---------|---------|---------|
| **essere felice che** | to be happy that | Sono felice che tu sia qui |
| **essere triste che** | to be sad that | Sono triste che tu parta |
| **avere paura che** | to be afraid that | Ho paura che non funzioni |
| **temere che** | to fear that | Temo che sia troppo tardi |

### Verbs of Opinion/Doubt

| Italian | English | Example |
|---------|---------|---------|
| **pensare che** | to think that | Penso che tu sia speciale |
| **credere che** | to believe that | Credo che mi ami |
| **dubitare che** | to doubt that | Dubito che sia vero |
| **non essere sicuro che** | to not be sure that | Non sono sicuro che venga |

<CultureTip title="Fact vs. Opinion" flag="üáÆüáπ">
Use the indicative (regular) mood when stating facts: "So che mi ami" (I know you love me). Use the subjunctive when expressing opinions or uncertainty: "Penso che tu mi ami" (I think you love me). The difference is certainty vs. subjectivity.
</CultureTip>

## Romantic Subjunctive Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Qualunque cosa succeda, ti amer√≤"
  translation="Whatever happens, I will love you"
  pronunciation="kwal-OON-kweh KO-zah sook-CHEH-dah, tee ah-meh-ROH"
  example="Non preoccuparti, qualunque cosa succeda, ti amer√≤ sempre."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ovunque tu vada, verr√≤ con te"
  translation="Wherever you go, I will come with you"
  pronunciation="oh-VOON-kweh too VAH-dah, vehr-ROH kon teh"
  example="Non mi importa dove, ovunque tu vada, verr√≤ con te."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Prima che tu dica qualcosa..."
  translation="Before you say something..."
  pronunciation="PREE-mah keh too DEE-kah kwal-KO-zah"
  example="Prima che tu dica qualcosa, voglio che tu sappia quanto ti amo."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sebbene sia difficile, ce la faremo"
  translation="Although it's difficult, we'll make it"
  pronunciation="seb-BEH-neh SEE-ah deef-FEE-chee-leh, cheh lah fah-REH-mo"
  example="Sebbene sia difficile la distanza, ce la faremo insieme."
/>

## Common Subjunctive Expressions

| Expression | Meaning | Followed by Subjunctive |
|------------|---------|------------------------|
| **Bisogna che** | It's necessary that | Bisogna che tu venga |
| **√à importante che** | It's important that | √à importante che parliamo |
| **√à possibile che** | It's possible that | √à possibile che arrivi tardi |
| **√à meglio che** | It's better that | √à meglio che tu riposi |
| **Affinch√©** | So that | Affinch√© tu capisca |
| **A meno che** | Unless | A meno che tu non voglia |
| **Bench√©** | Although | Bench√© sia stanco |

## Practice Conversations

### Expressing Care

**Partner A:** Come ti senti oggi?
**Partner B:** Un po' stanco. Perch√©?
**Partner A:** Voglio che tu ti riposi. √à importante che tu stia bene.
**Partner B:** Grazie amore, sono felice che tu ti preoccupi per me.

### Making Plans

**Partner A:** Spero che domani faccia bel tempo.
**Partner B:** Anche io! Desidero che possiamo fare quella passeggiata.
**Partner A:** Qualunque tempo faccia, sar√† bello stare insieme.

### Sharing Feelings

**Partner A:** Penso che tu sia la persona pi√π speciale del mondo.
**Partner B:** Davvero? Sono felice che tu pensi cos√¨.
**Partner A:** Credo che siamo destinati a stare insieme.
**Partner B:** Anch'io spero che sia vero.

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Exercise 1: Express Your Wishes
Take turns completing these sentences:
- Voglio che tu... (I want you to...)
- Spero che noi... (I hope we...)
- Desidero che la nostra relazione... (I wish our relationship...)

### Exercise 2: Share Your Feelings
Express emotions using the subjunctive:
- Sono felice che... (I'm happy that...)
- Ho paura che... (I'm afraid that...)
- Mi rende triste che... (It makes me sad that...)

### Exercise 3: Give Opinions
Share your thoughts about each other:
- Penso che tu sia... (I think you are...)
- Credo che noi... (I believe we...)
- Non dubito che tu... (I don't doubt that you...)

## Quick Reference

**Subjunctive Triggers to Remember:**
1. Wishing verbs: volere, sperare, desiderare
2. Emotion verbs: essere felice/triste, avere paura
3. Opinion verbs: pensare, credere, dubitare
4. Impersonal expressions: √® importante, bisogna, √® possibile
5. Conjunctions: bench√©, affinch√©, prima che, a meno che

<VocabCard
  word="Che la nostra storia non finisca mai"
  translation="May our story never end"
  pronunciation="keh lah NOS-trah STOR-ee-ah non fee-NEE-skah MY"
  example="Ti amo. Che la nostra storia non finisca mai."
/>

The subjunctive adds poetry and emotion to your Italian. It's how Italians express the full range of human feeling - hopes, fears, dreams, and doubts. Practice these forms with your partner, and your Italian conversations will become richer and more meaningful. **In bocca al lupo!** (Good luck!)

<CTA text="Ready to master the Italian subjunctive together?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />
